radiographic_examinations.findings: Ill-defined, rounded, patchy opacities, none larger than 2 cm in diameter, in both lungs; no lymphadenopathy or pleural effusions observed, and the cardiomediastinal silhouette was normal.

Multiple patchy, ground-glass opacities in a central and peripheral distribution throughout both lungs; some lesions had a rounded shape and some had a central radiolucency, consistent with cavitation; no obvious hilar or mediastinal lymphadenopathy.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: No change in the bilateral opacities and no new lesions observed in another CT scan performed four days prior to admission.
